newsitem.title: YEMEN: Yemen to attend Islamic summit in Tehran.
newsitem.headline: Yemen to attend Islamic summit in Tehran.

text.p: Yemeni President Ali Abdullah Saleh told visiting Iranian Foreign Minister Ali Akbar Velayati on Thursday he would attend an Islamic summit in Tehran in December, the state-run news agency SABA said.
Velayati, on a regional tour, arrived in Sanaa earlier in the day with an invitation to the summit from Iranian President Akbar Hashemi Rafsanjani, it said.
"President Saleh thanked him for the invitation and said he accepted it."

Velayati arrived in Yemen after visiting Egypt, Lebanon and Syria with similar invitations. The leaders of the three Arab countries told him they would go to Tehran for the Organisation of the Islamic Conference summit.
The OIC was formed in 1969 and now has 52 members. It is based in the Saudi city of Jeddah.
